name: AZO Tracking – Google Analytics for WordPress(GA4) & much more
author: AZO Team

sections.description:
AZO Tracking is a powerful tool for managing Google Analytics data in WordPress. It offers a variety of features to track and display your website’s analytics in a user-friendly interface.

Home · Help & Support ·

Features

  • Integrate GA4 into your website.
  • Display Google Analytics statistics with a sleek UI/UX.
  • Track scroll depth events.
  • Monitor error events.
  • Host ‘gtag.js’ locally.
  • Configure GA4 script attributes.
  • Display a custom dashboard for specific user roles.
  • Create a customized statistics dashboard.

Google Analytics Statics

  • General stats
  • Daily visitors stats
  • Visitor devices stats
  • New vs. returning visitors stats
  • Operating systems stats
  • Referrer stats
  • Browser stats
  • Top pages stats
  • Current activity stats
  • Geographic stats

Support & Help

Send us a ticket. We will get back to you shortly in 24 hours.

Third-Party Services

This plugin relies on several third-party services to provide functionality such as advertising and content delivery. Below is a list of these services, including the circumstances under which they are used and links to their terms of use and privacy policies.

Google Analytics
– Description: Provides analytics services.
– Usage: Collects and analyzes data for website traffic and user behavior.
– Service URL: Google Analytics
– Terms of Use: Google Analytics Terms of Service
– Privacy Policy: Google Privacy Policy

Google OAuth
– Description: Provides user authentication and authorization services.
– Usage: Allows secure user login and access to Google Analytics data.
– Service URL: Google AdSense
– Terms of Use: Google AdSense Terms of Service
– Privacy Policy: Google Privacy Policy
sections.installation:
How to install the plugin and get it working?

Using The WordPress Dashboard (Recommended Installation)

  1. Navigate to the ‘Add New’ in the Plugins dashboard.
  2. Search for ‘AZO Tracking’.
  3. Click ‘Install Now’.
  4. Activate AZO Tracking on the Plugin dashboard.

Uploading in WordPress Dashboard

  1. Navigate to the ‘Add New’ in the Plugin dashboard.
  2. Navigate to the ‘Upload’ area.
  3. Select azo-tracking.zip from your computer.
  4. Click ‘Install Now’.
  5. Activate AZO Tracking in the Plugin dashboard.

Using FTP

  1. Download azo-tracking.zip
  2. Extract the azo-tracking directory to your computer
  3. Upload the azo-tracking directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  4. Activate AZO Tracking in the Plugin dashboard
sections.faq:
Is this plugin support GA4?

Yes. Our Plugin support GA4.

Could I report bugs and request new features?

Yes, we are always looking forward to hearing from you. You can report the bugs over here

How do I get in touch?

Just send us a ticket from here.
